Set maximum intake rate

Edit this page.   Source: R/MizerParams-class.R
changeIntakeMax.Rd

Set maximum intake rate

changeIntakeMax(params, intake_max = NULL, n = params@n)

Arguments

params

MizerParams
intake_max

Optional. An array (species x size) holding the maximum intake rate for each species at size. If not supplied, a default is set as described in the section "Setting maximum intake rate".
n

Scaling exponent of the intake rate.

Value

MizerParams

Setting maximum intake rate

The maximum intake rate \(h_i(w)\) of an individual of species \(i\) and weight \(w\) determines the feeding level, calculated with getFeedingLevel. It is measured in grams/year.

If the intake_max argument is not supplied, then the maximum intake rate is set to $$h_i(w) = h_i w^n.$$ The values of \(h_i\) (the maximum intake rate of an individual of size 1 gram) are taken from the h column in the species parameter dataframe. If the h column is not supplied in the species parameter dataframe, it is calculated by the get_h_default function, using f0 and the k_vb column, if they are supplied.

If \(h_i\) is set to Inf, fish will consume all encountered food.

See also

Other functions for changing parameters: changeBMort, changeFishing, changeInitial, changeInteraction, changeMetab, changeParams, changePlankton, changePredKernel, changeReproduction, changeResourceDynamics, changeResourceEncounter, changeSearchVolume, tuneParams
